lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Federal Judge Stops Effort to Overturn Suicide Law'' (news article, Nov. 9): This country is engaged in a war against fanatics who would impose their religious fundamentalism on everyone and whose rulers do not believe in the will of the people. Attorney General John Ashcroft is supposed to be tracking these people down and preventing them from interfering with our rights in a free, secular, democratic society. Instead, he is imposing his views about dying on the people of Oregon, who twice voted that if they are terminally ill, they might want a doctor's help to die peacefully.
abstract: Letter from Faye Girsh, president, Hemlock Society USA, scores Atty Gen John Ashcroft for imposing his own views about dying to people of Oregon, who twice voted that if they are terminally ill, they might want a doctor's help to die peacefully
